channel.title: Adding new models
channel.description: Ok, I feel like an idiot for having to ask this [I have looked through tuts, both on here and using google, and went through a few pages of help topics looking], but I can not add new models. I am using Corby Xevolution source, and its come-with client. I know most people dispise this, but I just started today with everything about model-editting [the datamaker, metasqueia {did I say that right?}, and converting to gZIP (I used 7zip to covnert to gzip)]. I followed a tutorial, in which, after converting through the file types to open it in metas----, I used 3385, for a dragon halberd, and simply re-colored it to a brighter yellow/blue as a "holy halberd". Saved the model, converted back, used datamaker and did the "Right-Hand" [after changing the 0 to 10] and zipping as a .gz file. I am using the model id 13000 for the wield and 13001 as the drop. I already modified the Class8 in the client, and I copy/pasted the files into the anim/Models folder [its the only model folder I saw]. I then, even though the tutorial did not say to, added the information for the item into the item.cfg of the source [bottom of list], with the item id 50000 [which was also used in the class8]. The problem is when I log in to the server, I type "Add model 13000" and/or "Add model 13001" and it always tells me that the model can not be found, something like "Unable to find model file.", and then I can not move or log out (but can still talk) until it disconnects me for a split second. After a couple of attempts, I copied the model files into every folder I could think or see that had any model files in them, or any connection to models, and no matter what attempt, it still failed. Also, as a side note, when I typed "::pickup 50000 1" it said "Not a true item." or "Item not found." or something of the sort. This is really stressing me, because I've read quite a few tutorials [including the "biggest tutorial ever" on this site] on what and how to do this, and it just does not work. I know this was long, and I appreciate all help this community gives. Thanks in advance.

item.title: Adding new models
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

KingKj52:

Haha, I just did that, to 15000 [client came with customs, didn’t wanan mess anything up] and it worked . I’m now searching for how to add a special attack to a custom weapon. [it doesn’t have to be custom, I don’t mind using one from another weapon]. Thanks for all the help, by-the-way. I appreciate it!

anytime.

Read full topic

item.title: Adding new models
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

lower the item id, its wayyy too high. make it like 10000.

Read full topic

item.title: Adding new models
item.dc:creator: @KingKj52 KingKj52
item.description:
@KingKj52 wrote:

Hmm, it didn’t work. Now, there was improvement, it didn’t say “No item found.”, but it didn’t have any effect. I checked the log, and it showed the command entering, but there was no item added. I then checked if the code became faulty by some idiot mistake I would have probably made, so I “::pickup 995 1”'d and it worked fine. Is there something I’m missing?

Edit: The pickup code is as follows:

if (command.startsWith("pickup") && playerRights >= 2) { String[] args = command.split(" "); if(args.length == 3) { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); if (newItemID <= 160000 && newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sM("No such item."); } } else { sM("Oops! Use as ::pickup 995 100"); } } }

I noticed what message it should send in the “else” statements, but, neither of those messages where sent, implying it worked, the item just isn’t there. I ran my mouse through each posistion of the inventory, and no name showed up [as in checking for a faulty model].

Edit2: I added the item manually to my bank, and when I opened the bank, it showed itself as dwarf remains, and then crashed me. Every time I opened the bank, I got the same result until, after 3 times, it did not automatically re-connect. Any help?

Server bat said this:

Exception encountered while parsing incoming packets from Kingkj52. java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 19999 at client.fromBank(client.java:9972) at client.parseIncomingPackets(client.java:16336) at client.packetProcess(client.java:18066) at PlayerHandler.process(PlayerHandler.java:268) at process.run(process.java:23) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) ClientHandler: Client Kingkj52 disconnected (127.0.0.1)

I’m guessing there is some sort of limit on how high the id goes all around. How or where can I change that?

Read full topic

item.title: Adding new models
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

KingKj52:

Thanks mate! It was set to 20000, so it should work now! I will test it and post back with the results. Thanks again! Last time I asked for help [year/2 ago] no one was quite this helpful…I appreciate that ^_^.

no problem. ^^

Read full topic

item.title: Adding new models
item.dc:creator: @KingKj52 KingKj52
item.description:
@KingKj52 wrote:

Thanks mate! It was set to 20000, so it should work now! I will test it and post back with the results. Thanks again! Last time I asked for help [year/2 ago] no one was quite this helpful…I appreciate that ^_^.

Read full topic

item.title: Adding new models
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

go into your server sided client.java, and search for your pickup command, inside of it you should see an if statement along the lines of.

if (newItemID <= #### && newItemID >= 0) {

increase #### to like 160000

dont worry, if you spawn an invalid item, itll just give you a null item.

Read full topic

item.title: Adding new models
item.dc:creator: @KingKj52 KingKj52
item.description:
@KingKj52 wrote:

I searched, and I got this:

public void preloadModels() { File file = new File("./Models/"); File[] fileArray = file.listFiles(); for(int y = 0; y < fileArray.length; y++) { String sss = fileArray[y].getName(); System.out.println("Parsing model file "+sss); byte[] buffer = ReadFile("./Models/"+sss); Class30_Sub2_Sub4_Sub6.method460(buffer, -4036, Integer.parseInt(getFileNameWithoutExtension(sss))); } }

the . I presume means where the base folder is located, so I guess I should make a new folder called “Models” and put them there? I will do this now. Thanks for the help. I’ll reply with the results.

Edit: Haha, it worked. Thanks mate! I owe you one! Again, sorry for wrong section. Still though, when I “::pickup 50000 1” it tells me “No such item.” Is there somewhere else, other then item.cfg, that I should put that information at. If so, where and what should I put? I appreciate all this help so far =]

Edit2: This is the class8 I have for this weapon:

if(i == 50000) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wield";//New option class8.anInt174 = 13001; //Model ID // 20233 class8.anInt181 = 2000; //zoom increase will make it smaller class8.anInt190 = 572; //model rotate up+down increase to move doen away from you class8.anInt198 = 0; //model rotate side ways increase to move right in circle class8.anInt169 = 25; // model offset increase to move to the right class8.anInt194 = 1; //model offset increase to move up class8.anInt165 = 13000;//male wearing // class8.anInt200 = 13000;//female wearing // class8.anInt164 = -1;//Female arms/sleeves // class8.anInt188 = -1;//male arms/sleeves // class8.aBoolean176 = false;//Stackable class8.aString170 = "Holy Halberd";//Name of the new item class8.aByteArray178 = "A holy halberd said to have been taken from a slain angel. --Made by KingKj52.".getBytes();//examin info }

Edit3: Thanks to whoever moved it into the right section =].

Read full topic

item.title: Adding new models
item.dc:creator: @KingKj52 KingKj52
item.description:
@KingKj52 wrote:

Oh yeah, sorry, I just noticed I was in server, not client, help. It was long because I was trying to explain everything so there wasn’t wasted time in “did you do this right?” or “did you forget to press/tick this button?” etc.

BTW, this is the tutorial I used (IDK if I can post a link to this specific site, so I’ll code it):

[code]OK, this is a tut on making custom weapons for your 317-377
It might work on 474, but i have not tested, due to the fact that I despise 474s.

Difficulty: 6/10
Description: Adding/Making custom items
Tested on: pwnscape(377) and QC-life(317)
Files Modified:class8.java
Assumed:You own/rent a brain, you can read

Get some downloads
You need a client with the java files, or atleast class8.java

Metasequoia http://www.mediafire.com/download.php?mrom2t1yotd
DAT Maker http://www.mediafire.com/download.php?2fnyozjtfzn
7z http://www.mediafire.com/download.php?z1hfjclozzz
RS Models http://www.mediafire.com/download.php?yynmozd55r2
Items IDs http://www.mediafire.com/download.php?bokmdday2mi

After the downloads are done and decompiled…
Open up item int list and search(control+F) for the item you want for a base for your custom item. Under it, you should see
Code:
//male wield viewthe number to the left is the one you need to remember.

Open up…
datamaker.exe
Now open up the METASEQUOIA folder, but not the .exe
and make a new folder called models. On DATMAKER, file>open>metasequoia>models. No you File>open>rsmodel viewer>models>####(item number)
click on it and it should display on the screen, the File>export>MQO

Now open up…
metasequoia.exe and File>open>metasequoia>models>####.MQO
(if its not there, just try to find it, its in a folder somewhere, lol)
it should spring up on the screen, now you may edit it to your hearts’ desire.

After that…
go to file>save as>metasequoia>models>ITEM NAME W
W stands for wield
Now select all of your new custom weapon, and move it to the ground, and rotate it, so looks flat and is adjacent to the ground.
File>Save as>Metasequoia>Models>ITEM NAME D
D stands for drop

Ok, now that that’s done…
go back to your RS datmaker program, and import the wield model now at the top next to a green box it should say
Code:
prioritiesselect that box, and your weapon will have black dots all over it.
on the bottome left corner, you should see
Code:
0/0change the first 0 to 10.
Now there should be a dropbox that says no anim, open it and scroll down to right-hand and select. Now click make .dat button

Do the same for the drop model, but instead of right-hand, it should be no anim.

Open up…
7z folder and open 7zFM. Find metasequoia>models
then select the wield model and click on the green ‘+’ key
a screen should pop up, then click ok. Do the same for the drop model.
now drag the wield model and drag it to your clients model folder. Rename it to 13000.gz. Drag the drop model and rename it 13001.gz.

Go open up…
class8.java, search for
Code:
class8.method203(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_183);
underneath add this

Code:
if(i == Item Number) {
class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
class8.aStringArray189[1] = “Wield”;//New option
class8.anInt174 = Drop Model Number; //Model ID // 20233
class8.anInt181 = 2000; //zoom increase will make it smaller
class8.anInt190 = 572; //model rotate up+down increase to move doen away from you
class8.anInt198 = 0; //model rotate side ways increase to move right in circle
class8.anInt169 = 25; // model offset increase to move to the right
class8.anInt194 = 1; //model offset increase to move up
class8.anInt165 = Wield Model Number;//male wearing //
class8.anInt200 = Wield Model Number;//female wearing //
class8.anInt164 = -1;//Female arms/sleeves //
class8.anInt188 = -1;//male arms/sleeves //
class8.aBoolean176 = false;//Stackable
class8.aString170 = “Item Name”;//Name of the new item
class8.aByteArray178 = “Item Examine Info”.getBytes();//examin info
}

ok, ITEM Number denotes the item id you want
Drop Model Number denotes the .gz file, which in this case is 13001
Wield Model Number denotes the .gz file, which in this case is 13000
Item Name denotes the name of your item
Item Examine Info denotes what the description is if you ingame examine it.

Finally…
save and compile, then run your server.
Once on your server you must say this

Code:
add model 13000and
Code:
add model 13001It should say Item Model found, or something like that.
Then do ::pickup ITEM-ID AMOUNT

If I missed anything, please post, or pm me.
I think this should be stickied, but that’s my opinion.

Good job.
To me.[/code]

Death, where can I find that? I’d assume its in the client.java, but what could I specifically search for, as I have tried searching, but with no prevail.

P.S.: Thanks for the speedy replies and insight, I truly appreciate it. =]

Read full topic

item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Wrong section
@Topic
Look to see where custom models are loaded from, than put the models in the right folder.
